meanings.definition: To change the color of something.
meanings.sent1: I will recolor my room walls from blue to green.
meanings.sent2: She decided to recolor her old dress to make it look new.
meanings.sent3: The artist tried to recolor the sky pink, but it looked strange.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to recolor the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand could recolor anything it touched.

meanings.definition: To give a new color to something.
meanings.sent1: He will recolor his bike to match his new helmet.
meanings.sent2: The painter was hired to recolor the faded sign outside the shop.
meanings.sent3: The idea to recolor the cat's fur purple was quickly dismissed.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to recolor the world with hope.
meanings.sent5: The sunset recolored the sky with shades of orange and pink.
